alert.note: Alert for Santa Catalina and Rincon Mountains including Mount Lemmon, Summerhaven; Tohono O'odham Nation including Sells; Tucson Metro Area including Tucson, Green Valley, Marana, Vail; Upper Santa Cruz River and Altar Valleys including Nogales (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 11:20AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Pima and northwestern Cochise Counties through NOON MST... At 1119 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Saguaro National Park East to Three Points. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tucson, Sahuarita, Green Valley, Davis-Monthan Air Force Base, Drexel Heights, Flowing Wells, Tanque Verde, Vail, South Tucson, Three Points, Pascua Pueblo Yaqui Reservation, East Sahuarita, Sabino Canyon Recreation Area, Summit, Tucson Estates, Catalina Foothills, Corona De Tucson, Valencia West, Tucson International Airport and Saguaro National Park East. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 255 and 286. Interstate 19 between mile markers 35 and 63. Route 77 between mile markers 70 and 71. Route 83 between mile markers 56 and 58. Route 86 between mile markers 144 and 171. Route 286 between mile markers 40 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
